Students get on one of the new CATA Loop buses PERIOD The extralong buses which one driver called his Golden Dragon are CATAs solution to overcrowding PERIOD

Advertisement

For the next two weeks students will be able to take a goldencolored Loop around campus with about  of their closest friends PERIOD

The Centre Area Transportation Authority CATA is now testing a new 60foot articulated bus which has two connected vehicle sections to transport students and residents downtown and on campus PERIOD

CATA will use a bus which it borrowed from Port Authority Transit PAT in Pittsburgh with an accordionlike addition connecting the front and back sections PERIOD

 Eric Bernier CATA director of service development said PERIOD 

While the standard 40foot CATA buses can seat about  passengers with another  standing the trial buses can seat  passengers with another  standing PERIOD

Throughout the test period CATA will examine the communitys reaction the larger buss feasibility for the current routes and CATAs ability to maintain a bus of this size PERIOD

Mary Edson freshmanpsychology said adding a larger bus would ease overcrowding PERIOD

 Edson said PERIOD

Penn States Department of Transportation Services has been working with CATA for several years to improve the overcrowding of buses traveling through campus PERIOD

 said Bruce Younkin manager of fleet operations for transportation services PERIOD 

The articulated bus began its test period last weekend as both the Blue and White Loops but Bernier said it may also operate on other routes PERIOD

The Waupelani Drive Vairo Boulevard and Martin StreetAaron Drive routes are all very crowded especially during the day Bernier said PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

In addition to size there are several differences between the articulated bus and the standard CATA buses PERIOD

 Younkin said PERIOD

The shorter turning radius does have its downside though PERIOD The articulated bus has a much higher price tag than the standard buses PERIOD

 Bernier said PERIOD

CATA has not used the articulated buses in the past because they were not made with clean natural gas which CATA uses PERIOD Now two major companies are manufacturing the articulated buses with clean natural gas PERIOD

The articulated bus borrowed from PAT is complete with plush seats and armrests which Bernier said would be removed if CATA decided to bring a similar bus to Centre County PERIOD
